snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s plan to cut spending was unveiled on Tuesday as Democrats circulated the outlines of their budget, repudiating many aspects of the Republican effort.
abstract: Senate Democrats and House Republicans outline vastly divergent approaches to shoring up government finances, reminder of how far part parties remain on fiscal policy despite agreement that compromise is possible; Republican proposal, led by Rep Paul Ryan, relies heavily on policies that attracted heavy criticism during 2012 presidential campaign.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Mark Landler and Jada F. Smith contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Representative Paul D. Ryan’s plan to cut spending was unveiled on Tuesday as Democrats circulated the outlines of their budget, repudiating many aspects of the Republican effort.

headline.main: 2 Parties’ Budgets Show Big Rift as G.O.P. Renews 2012 Proposals
headline.print_headline: 2 Parties’ Budgets Show Big Rift As G.O.P. Renews 2012 Proposals
